Authors: Gonzalo Platas, Fernando Pelaez, Francisco Arenal
Title:
A new endophytic species of Preussia (Sporormiaceae) inferred
from morphological observations and molecular phylogenetic analysis
Abstract:
A new species of Preussia as an endophyte of different
typical Mediterranean plant species, is newly described and illustrated
based on molecular and morphological features. Preussia mediterranea
resembles P. australis, P. africana and P. similis from a morphological
point of view, but appeared closer to P minima and P. isabellae by
molecular analysis. Phylogenetic analysis of the entire ITS region
combined with the D1-D2 domains of the 28S rRNA gene, and a fragment of
the elongation factor EF-1√ë gene, using Maximum Likelihood and a
Bayesian Markov Chain Monte Carlo approach, generally resulted in
statistically well-supported clades for all the species studied.
Morphological data and molecular phylogenetic analysis supported the
recognition of the new taxon
